metadata.title: AI-Enhanced ML-FAANG Mastery Plan
metadata.description: 20-week comprehensive roadmap for ML researchers transitioning to FAANG software engineering roles with AI-powered learning assistance

phases.name: Foundation & Basic Patterns
phases.description: Master fundamental data structures and algorithms with AI coaching

phases.name: Advanced Data Structures
phases.description: Deep dive into complex data structures and tree algorithms

phases.name: Advanced Algorithms & System Design
phases.description: Master complex algorithmic concepts and ML system design

phases.name: Company-Specific Preparation
phases.description: Company-focused preparation and advanced interview techniques

phases.name: Interview Mastery & Specialization
phases.description: Final preparation with mock interviews and specialization

1.title: AI Environment Setup + Arrays & Hashing + Real ML System Integration
objectives: Set up complete AI-enhanced development environment with advanced tools
Master Arrays & Hashing patterns with 25+ problems and 90%+ accuracy
Connect hash tables to ML embeddings and recommendation systems
Implement custom hash table with ML-inspired optimizations
Study YouTube Recommendation System architecture with hash tables
Establish AI coaching system with personalized prompts

sessions.title: AI Ecosystem Bootstrap + Core Array Problems
sessions.description: Set up AI learning environment, solve Two Sum, Best Time to Buy/Sell Stock, and Contains Duplicate with AI coaching connecting to ML systems

problems.name: Two Sum
problems.description: Connect to embedding lookups in transformers
problems.ai_prompt: Explain Two Sum using hash tables like vocabulary mappings in tokenizers. How does this relate to attention mechanisms in transformers?

problems.name: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
problems.description: Relate to gradient optimization
problems.ai_prompt: How does this greedy algorithm relate to finding optimal points in loss function landscapes?

problems.name: Contains Duplicate
problems.description: AI coaching on set operations vs hash tables
problems.ai_prompt: Compare set-based and hash table solutions. How does this relate to efficient data deduplication in ML pipelines?

sessions.title: Hash Maps Deep Dive + ML System Applications
sessions.description: Hash table theory with AI explanations, solve Valid Anagram and Group Anagrams connecting to NLP and clustering, study Instagram Feed Ranking

problems.name: Valid Anagram
problems.description: Connect to text preprocessing in NLP
problems.ai_prompt: How does anagram detection relate to text normalization and preprocessing in NLP pipelines?

problems.name: Group Anagrams
problems.description: Relate to clustering algorithms in ML
problems.ai_prompt: Compare this grouping approach to clustering algorithms. How does the hash key strategy relate to feature engineering?

problems.name: Top K Frequent Elements
problems.description: Connect to attention mechanisms
problems.ai_prompt: How does selecting top-K elements relate to attention mechanisms and ranking in recommendation systems?

ai_prompts.text: Help me configure the optimal AI-enhanced development environment for ML engineering interviews. Include VS Code extensions, AI tools (Claude, GPT-4, Copilot), and custom prompt templates for connecting DS&A to ML systems.

Explain how hash tables relate to my ML background - embedding lookups, attention mechanisms, vocabulary mappings in transformers. Provide coding examples connecting Two Sum to transformer operations.
Create a personalized study plan based on my ML research background. Identify knowledge gaps in DS&A and suggest optimal learning sequence for FAANG interviews with AI assistance.

2.title: Two Pointers & Sliding Window + Meta ML Infrastructure
objectives: Master Two Pointers patterns with AI optimization for 30+ problems
Implement sliding window algorithms connecting to convolution operations
Study Meta's Deep Learning Recommendation Model (DLRM)
Build AI-Enhanced Sliding Window Algorithm Visualizer project
Complete advanced AI mock interview with Meta focus
Connect sliding windows to time series analysis and CNNs

sessions.title: Two Pointers Foundation + Meta ML Study
sessions.description: Two pointers theory with AI connections to parallel processing, solve Valid Palindrome, Two Sum II, 3Sum with AI coaching, study Meta's DLRM architecture

problems.name: Valid Palindrome
problems.description: AI coaching on string manipulation and two-pointer technique
problems.ai_prompt: How does two-pointer palindrome checking relate to parallel processing patterns in distributed ML systems?

problems.name: Two Sum II - Input Array Is Sorted
problems.description: Connect to binary search optimization techniques
problems.ai_prompt: Compare the two-pointer approach to binary search. How does this efficiency relate to optimization algorithms in ML?

problems.name: 3Sum
problems.description: AI optimization for O(nÂ²) complexity and duplicate handling
problems.ai_prompt: How does the 3Sum algorithm relate to finding triplets in embedding spaces or feature combinations in ML models?

problems.name: Container With Most Water
problems.description: Connect to optimization and greedy algorithms
problems.ai_prompt: How does this greedy optimization approach relate to loss function minimization and optimization in ML training?

problems.name: Trapping Rain Water
problems.description: Advanced two-pointer technique with dynamic programming connections
problems.ai_prompt: Compare the two-pointer solution to dynamic programming. How does this relate to different optimization strategies in ML?

sessions.title: Sliding Window Fundamentals + Time Series Applications
sessions.description: Sliding window patterns with AI analogies to convolution operations, solve Longest Substring Without Repeating, connect to attention mechanisms and time series analysis

problems.name: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
problems.description: Master sliding window with dynamic size adjustment
problems.ai_prompt: How does this sliding window approach relate to attention mechanisms and receptive fields in CNNs?

problems.name: Sliding Window Maximum
problems.description: Advanced sliding window with deque optimization
problems.ai_prompt: Connect this deque-based sliding window to pooling operations in CNNs and time series analysis in ML.

problems.name: Minimum Window Substring
problems.description: Complex sliding window with character frequency tracking
problems.ai_prompt: How does this pattern matching relate to subsequence finding in NLP and attention pattern analysis?

problems.name: Longest Repeating Character Replacement
problems.description: Sliding window with constraint optimization
problems.ai_prompt: Connect this constrained optimization to regularization techniques and constraint handling in ML training.

problems.name: Permutation in String
problems.description: Pattern matching with sliding window technique
problems.ai_prompt: How does this pattern detection relate to feature detection in computer vision and sequence matching in NLP?

ai_prompts.text: Help me master two-pointer and sliding window techniques for Week 2. Connect these patterns to parallel processing in distributed ML and gradient descent convergence. Provide optimization strategies.
Simulate a Meta-style technical interview focusing on sliding window problems. Evaluate my coding speed, pattern recognition, and ability to connect algorithms to ML infrastructure like DLRM.
Explain how sliding window algorithms apply to time series analysis, CNN operations, and real-time inference systems. Help me build connections between these patterns and Meta's ML infrastructure.

3.title: Stack & Queue Patterns + Production ML Systems
objectives: Master Stack & Queue patterns with 28+ problems and AI coaching
Implement monotonic stack algorithms with performance optimization
Study Amazon SageMaker and production ML pipeline architecture
Build AI-Powered Expression Evaluator & Computational Graph Parser
Connect stack operations to computational graphs and parsing
Complete advanced AI mock interview with behavioral components

sessions.title: Stack Fundamentals + Computational Graph Connections
sessions.description: Stack theory with AI connections to function calls and parsing, solve Valid Parentheses, Min Stack, Evaluate RPN connecting to computational graphs and expression parsing

problems.name: Valid Parentheses
problems.description: AI coaching on balanced structures and stack operations
problems.ai_prompt: How does stack-based parentheses validation relate to computational graph construction and parsing in ML frameworks?

problems.name: Min Stack
problems.description: AI optimization for O(1) operations and data structure design
problems.ai_prompt: Connect the Min Stack design to efficient tracking of minimum values in streaming ML algorithms and online learning.

problems.name: Evaluate Reverse Polish Notation
problems.description: Connect to expression trees and computational graphs
problems.ai_prompt: How does RPN evaluation relate to computational graph execution in deep learning frameworks like PyTorch and TensorFlow?

problems.name: Generate Parentheses
problems.description: AI coaching on backtracking with stacks and state space exploration
problems.ai_prompt: Connect this backtracking approach to neural architecture search and automated ML model generation.

problems.name: Basic Calculator
problems.description: Advanced expression parsing with precedence and associativity
problems.ai_prompt: How does expression parsing relate to symbolic differentiation and automatic differentiation in ML?

sessions.title: Queue Patterns + Production ML Pipeline Study
sessions.description: Queue theory for BFS and scheduling, solve Design Circular Queue and Moving Average, study Amazon SageMaker pipeline architecture and ML production systems

problems.name: Daily Temperatures
problems.description: AI coaching on monotonic stack technique and optimization
problems.ai_prompt: How does the monotonic stack approach relate to maintaining ordering in ML algorithms and time series processing?

problems.name: Car Fleet
problems.description: Connect to scheduling and optimization algorithms
problems.ai_prompt: How does this scheduling problem relate to job scheduling in distributed ML training and resource allocation?

problems.name: Largest Rectangle in Histogram
problems.description: Advanced monotonic stack with optimization challenges
problems.ai_prompt: Connect this optimization problem to finding optimal architectures and hyperparameter space exploration in ML.

problems.name: Implement Queue using Stacks
problems.description: Design patterns and data structure efficiency
problems.ai_prompt: How does this design pattern relate to building efficient data pipelines and buffering in ML production systems?

problems.name: Sliding Window Maximum
problems.description: Deque implementation with sliding window optimization
problems.ai_prompt: Connect this deque-based approach to efficient sliding window operations in time series analysis and CNN pooling.

problems.name: Design Hit Counter
problems.description: Queue-based system design and time-based data structures
problems.ai_prompt: How does this time-based counting relate to metrics collection and monitoring in ML production systems?

ai_prompts.text: Help me master stack and queue patterns for Week 3. Focus on monotonic stack techniques, expression parsing, and connections to computational graph construction in ML frameworks like PyTorch.
Explain how stack and queue patterns apply to production ML systems, job scheduling, and pipeline processing. Connect these concepts to Amazon SageMaker and real-time inference systems.
Conduct a technical interview focusing on stack/queue problems with behavioral components. Evaluate my technical communication, code quality, and ability to explain complex algorithms clearly.

4.title: Binary Search Mastery + AI Problem Generation + Microsoft ML Systems
objectives: Master binary search patterns with 25+ problems and mathematical analysis
Implement binary search on answers with optimization theory connections
Study Microsoft's ML infrastructure and Azure ML services
Connect binary search to hyperparameter optimization and neural architecture search
Complete Phase 1 capstone project with AI optimization library
Achieve 70%+ AI assessment score for Phase 2 readiness

sessions.description: Binary search theory with AI mathematical proofs, solve Binary Search, Search in Rotated Array, Find First/Last Position connecting to optimization algorithms and grid search

problems.name: Binary Search
problems.description: AI coaching on boundary conditions and invariants
problems.ai_prompt: How does binary search relate to hyperparameter optimization and gradient descent convergence in ML?

problems.name: Search in Rotated Sorted Array
problems.description: AI pattern recognition coaching for modified binary search
problems.ai_prompt: Connect rotated array search to handling data distribution shifts and robust optimization in ML systems.

problems.name: Find First and Last Position of Element in Sorted Array
problems.description: AI boundary analysis and range finding techniques
problems.ai_prompt: How does range finding relate to confidence intervals and uncertainty estimation in ML predictions?

problems.name: Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array
problems.description: Advanced binary search with optimization principles
problems.ai_prompt: Connect finding minimum in rotated arrays to loss function optimization and local minimum detection in ML.

problems.ai_prompt: How does finding medians relate to statistical analysis and data distribution understanding in ML?

problems.name: Koko Eating Bananas
problems.description: AI coaching on search space definition and optimization

problems.name: Split Array Largest Sum

problems.ai_prompt: How does this partitioning problem relate to data splitting and distributed computing in ML systems?

ai_prompts.text: Help me master binary search patterns for Week 4 with focus on mathematical intuition. Connect these algorithms to hyperparameter optimization, neural architecture search, and optimization theory in ML.
Simulate a Microsoft-style technical interview focusing on binary search problems. Emphasize mathematical reasoning, optimization approaches, and connections to Azure ML infrastructure.
Evaluate my Phase 1 readiness across arrays, hashing, two pointers, sliding window, stack/queue, and binary search patterns. Provide comprehensive feedback and Phase 2 preparation recommendations.

ai_prompts.text: Help me master heap and priority queue patterns for Week 5. Focus on streaming data applications, real-time processing, and connections to Netflix's recommendation system architecture.
Explain how heaps and priority queues are used in large-scale ML systems for task scheduling, resource allocation, and real-time recommendation serving. Connect to Netflix's ML infrastructure.
